channel.title: 2011 on Michael's Prelims Site
channel.description: Recent content in 2011 on Michael's Prelims Site

item.title: Cooper, Marilyn. 'Rhetorical Agency as Emergent and Enacted.'
item.description: One Liner Individual agency emerges from embodied processes, and is inescapable for embodied beings (443). Summary Agency is an emergent quality rather than something that is a quality of the subject. With this view, we need to take careful consideration of the ethics and responsibility of using and approaching agency in writing and composition. From Notes: Conscious and non-conscious control over agency Complex systems theory - expression of agency as a perturbation Agent are unique, embodied individuals Agency emerges from within interactions in the system Serves as a bringing together of modern critical theory, post-modernism, and neuroscience.
